message: been playing with plistlib / etree. need to refactor the parsing to use namedtuple
So very handy
they're useful if you are inspecting the class before an object is actually instantiated
new in 2.6: http://docs.python.org/library/collections.html?highlight=namedtuple#collections.namedtuple
True. I've seen the horror of instantiating an object to inspect it so you can instantiate the REAL object. That was PHP though.
hehe, slight bug in the price check logic
named tuple += 1
We have things we call DTOs at work, but they have behaviour (they know how to serialize themselves, and have the concept of "visited" when being filled out)
namedtuple is not available on python2.5 I presume?
but this might help: http://pypi.python.org/pypi/jaraco.compat
(btw, frederick lundh's plist parser is 3x faster than plistlib)
hmm, doesn't look like etree exposes a way to seamlessly use named tuples
coming from plone/zope, there's the catalog "brain" object that is mostly just state, but has a getObject call to get the full-blown object represented by the brain.
ahha
@tbatterii I thought I saw a namedtuple implementation for 2.5 and googled, but that's not the one I remember
each day I hate appengine more and more :(
Yea, namedtuple is about 5x better on memory than dict and objects
